Description:
As an arrow whizzes past, narrowly grazing a strand of your hair and embedding itself in a nearby tree, a magical residue lingers in its wake. Eyes peeled for its source, you don't see where, but you know who: Elves. This was a warning shot.
Elves, tall and slender beings, embody an innate elegance that seems to flow through their every movement. They possess a discerning nature, categorizing their own tribes based on the environments they call home, and this comes with a prejudice that runs deep in their societies. Wood Elves, deeply attuned to the natural world, find solace amidst the verdant embrace of ancient forests. Hy Elves, on the other hand, thrive in the bustling energy of cities, harnessing their keen intellect and adaptability to flourish amidst the urban landscape. And in the depths beneath the earth, the Drough Elves navigate the hidden realms, where shadows and secrets intertwine.
Unlike most races, Elves do not sleep, but rather, they enter a meditative state to rejuvenate their spirits and minds. Deprived of the realm of dreams, their minds remain sharply focused on the present, always attuned to the world around them. This heightened awareness intertwines with their natural affinity for magic. Whether drawing upon the ancient forces of nature or delving into the depths of arcane arts, Elves possess an inherent connection to the mystical energies that course through the realms.

Creation.Stat Restrictions: Your Dexterity and Intelligence must be at least 1.

Language: You speak Common and a number of languages of choice equal to your Intelligence (one of which must be Elvish).

~Meditation~.Effect:
As an Elf, your sleep is more akin to meditation and you only need 4 hours of sleep per night.
Elves don't dream and can still hear and smell while sleeping, but at a lower responsiveness.

~The Blade Dance~.Effect: When you land the killing strike on a Worthy Enemy, you reset your movement this turn and are immune to Fumbling this turn (and you can continue your Movement).
~The Blade Dance~.Notes: If you were already Fumbling, you remove it.

~Arcane Veins~.Effect: You have access to the Arcane Spell School, no matter what class you are.

Starting Abilities Description:
Elves are naturally swift and gracious, thus being able to make extra agile steps during battle.
A Worthy Enemy is a normal Enemy Unit in a Combat Encounter.
Enemies defeated in "quick combat" do not count as Worthy, and Minion Units are not Worthy.
Also, defenseless units do not count as Worthy.

~Lithe~.Effect: While below 50% Health, you are immune to Fumbling and you can Break your Movement into as many parts as you want.
~Lithe~.Notes:
Fumbling is when you move away from an enemy's melee attack range; if you are Fumbling, all your actions have Cover.
Breaking your Movement means you can Move, do an Action, then continue your Movement.

~Mana Tap~.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters must pass an Intelligence Check or be Silenced.

~Natural Swiftness~.Effect: This turn, you gain +5 Movement Speed and can Break your Movement into as many parts as you want.
~Natural Swiftness~.Notes: Breaking your Movement means you can Move, do an Action, then continue your Movement.

~Landsperson~.Effect: Choose one land specialty Ability from Coven of the Land Druid specialization and learn it permanently (e.g. choose between Raise Wall, Storm, Wild Roots and Endurance and you get it).
~Landsperson~.Notes: This can't be changed, so choose wisely!

~Agile Technique~.Effect: You can use any weapon with your Dexterity Stat (instead of Might, in some cases).
